plugins.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
plugins.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way  in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.

accepted.name: Alexandra (Sasha) Hunter
accepted.description: I do graphic and product design.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of titles get frames with those titles

125014.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
125014.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way  in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.
125014.tagline: Paste a list of titles get frames with those titles

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

117829.name: Recount
117829.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
117829.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

plugins.name: AVA Companion Plugin
plugins.description:
The AvaHub Batch Crop Importer plugin simplifies the design workflow by seamlessly importing crops generated by AvaHub.ai directly into Figma. AvaHub generates precise image crops, and this plugin allows you to batch import them effortlessly into your Figma workspace.


Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.
plugins.tagline: A tool to batch crop your ava images

Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.

plugins.name: Page Navigator
plugins.description:
Overview

Page Navigator is a tool that helps you organize and navigate through complex Figma documents. It provides both page management features and the ability to create beautiful navigation indexes that make it easy for users to jump between pages.


Key Features

Navigation Index Generation

- Create comprehensive page indexes with clickable navigation links

- Smart positioning: places index at document start or after cover page

- Professional table layout with clean typography and alternating row colors

- Updates existing indexes instead of creating duplicates

- Intelligent page classification with automatic numbering

- Real-time navigation to any page with direct links


Smart Page Management

- Add, rename, duplicate, and delete pages

- Drag & drop reordering

- Bulk operations with multi-select

- Real-time search and filtering


How to Use

Creating a Navigation Index

1. **Open the Plugin**: Launch "Page Navigator" from the Figma plugins menu

2. **Click "Create Navigation Index"**: This generates a new page with a comprehensive index

3. **Navigate**: Click any " Go to Page" link in the generated index to jump directly to that page


Section Organizers (Not Linked)

- Pages starting with folder icon or down arrow

- Behavior: Listed in index but not numbered and no clickable links

- Purpose: Used for visual organization and section breaks


Special Pages (Linked but Not Numbered)

- Pages named: cover, changelog, contents, design language, resource links (case insensitive)

- Also includes variations: Cover Page, CHANGELOG, Table of Contents, Design System, etc.

- Example: Cover, COVER PAGE, Changelog, Contents, Design Language

- Behavior: Listed with clickable links but not numbered

- Purpose: Important pages that don't need sequential numbering


Hidden Pages (Linked but Not Numbered)

- Pages starting with . (period)

- Example: .template, .archive, .backup

- Behavior: Listed with clickable links but not numbered

- Purpose: Utility pages that should be accessible but not prominent


Regular Content Pages (Numbered and Linked)

- All other pages

- Example: Homepage, Product Details, User Dashboard

- Behavior: Numbered sequentially (1, 2, 3...) with clickable links

- Purpose: Main content pages in your design system


Automatically Excluded

- Divider pages: Pages with names consisting only of dashes (-, --, ---, , , etc.)

- The navigation index itself: Prevents self-referencing


Managing Pages

Adding Pages

1. Enter a page name in the input field

2. Click "Add Page" or press Enter

3. The new page is created and you're automatically switched to it


Renaming Pages

1. Click the "Rename" button next to any page

2. Edit the name inline

3. Press Enter to save or Escape to cancel


Reordering Pages

1. Use the drag handle next to any page name

2. Drag to the desired position

3. Pages are reordered in real-time


Deleting Pages

1. Select pages using checkboxes

2. Click "Delete Selected"

3. Confirm deletion (at least one page must remain)


Tips for Best Results

Naming Conventions

- Use Folder Section Name for major sections

- Use Down Arrow Subsection for subsections

- Name key pages cover, contents, etc. for special treatment

- Use .utility-name for templates and archives


Index Placement

- The index page is automatically placed at the beginning of your document

- If you have a page named "cover", the index is placed right after it

- This ensures logical document flow for viewers


Updating Indexes

- Re-run "Create Navigation Index" to update existing indexes

- The plugin detects existing indexes and updates them instead of creating duplicates

- Perfect for keeping navigation current as your document evolves


- Click "Add Page" to create a new page

- Enter the page name in the modern modal dialog

- The new page will be created and automatically selected

- Press Enter to create or Escape to cancel

- No more browser popup blocking issues


Duplicate Pages

- Click the duplicate button next to any page

- Creates an exact copy with " Copy" appended to the name

- Works with all page types including divider pages


Smart Page Features

- Divider Pages: Pages with only dashes (---, , , etc.) are displayed as "Divider" but retain their original functionality

- Current Page Protection: The currently active page is highlighted and cannot be deleted but can be renamed, duplicated, and reordered

- Auto-Update: UI automatically updates when you switch pages in Figma

- Bulk Operations: Select multiple pages for efficient batch operations


Mini Table of Contents (Mini TOC) for Folder Pages

- If you use a page name starting with a folder icon ( or ), the plugin will automatically generate a mini table of contents (Mini TOC) for all immediately following pages that start with (arrow) in their name.

- The Mini TOC is inserted directly into the folder page and lists all subpages ( pages) as clickable links.

- Divider pages (pages with only dashes) between folder and subpages are ignored, so all consecutive pages are included even if separated by dividers.

- The Mini TOC is automatically updated or removed if you re-run the index generation, ensuring it always matches your document structure.

- The Mini TOC is never created for the index page itself, and is only created if the folder page is valid and present.

- If a folder page or subpage is deleted or renamed, re-run "Create Navigation Index" to update the Mini TOC.
plugins.tagline: Manage document pages and create navigation indexes with direct clickable links.

plugins.name: UXtweak: Prototype Usability Testing
plugins.description:
With the UXtweak Prototype Usability Testing Plugin, you can easily turn your designs and prototypes into powerful user testing studiesright from Figma. 


Making it simple to gather invaluable user feedback for identifying and resolving issues before they impact development. 


The plugin ensures quick, reliable, and optimized import of even your largest and most complex Figma files, preserving all interactions and animations, while offering the flexibility to test specific flows or entire prototypes.


How it works:

  1. Open your Figma file.
  2. Click Share and copy the file link (set to Anyone with the link can view).
  3. Go to UXtweak and create a Prototype Testing study.
  4. In the Designs tab, paste your Figma file link.
  5. Copy the generated plugin link.
  6. Open the UXtweak Figma plugin and paste it in.
  7. Choose the flows you want to import and click Import.


Your prototype will be ready to test in UXtweakno exports, no uploads, just seamless usability testing.


Key features:


The plugin offers features to cover every aspect of your prototype usability testing needs.

  1. Seamless Figma integration: Quick import of your Figma prototypes, preserving designs and transitions.  
  2. Flexible study setup: Define custom tasks, add follow-up questions (survey) with skip logic (branching), and randomize task order.  
  3. Qualitative feedback: Capture screen, voice, and even face recordings to understand both what users do and why. Export videos in MP4 format for easy sharing.  
  4. Diverse recruitment options: Utilize our User Panel to recruit targeted participants for your studies, leverage your own database of users, or share a simple link.  
  5. Clickmaps & Heatmaps: Analyze clicks and identify hot spots to understand user attention.  
  6. Path analysis: Track exact user journeys, revealing where users get lost or deviate from expected flows.  
  7. Funnel view: Gain a detailed understanding of participant drop-off points.  
  8. Session replay: Replay full user sessions to observe behavior in context.  


Start for free at https://www.uxtweak.com/ or learn more about the plugin in our Knowledge Hub.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs and prototypes into powerful user testing studies on UXtweakright from Figma.

plugins.name: reflow
plugins.description:
Streamline User Flows in Minutes

Create flow easily with figjam connectors and shapes.


Features:

  1. Create connector automatically to two nodes
  2. Customize connector easily
  3. Basic shapes
  4. Flowchart shapes


How to use:

  1. Click the button once to copy the connector template.
  2. Once the template is created, hold Shift and select two objects. A connector will automatically be created between them, just like Autoflow.

plugins.name: Token Extractor & Kotlin Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you seamlessly export your design system tokens from Figma to Android development with Kotlin.


Key Features

Scan selected components or frames for design tokens

Supports primitives, spacing, and typography

Converts tokens into Android-compatible Kotlin objects (Colors.kt, Dimens.kt, Typography.kt)

Outputs clean, structured Kotlin code using dp, sp, and Color(...)

Friendly UI with JSON preview and file export options


Perfect for Android teams using Jetpack Compose and looking to keep design & code in sync.
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Android-ready Kotlin files.

138456.name: Token Extractor & Kotlin Exporter
138456.description:
This plugin helps you seamlessly export your design system tokens from Figma to Android development with Kotlin.


Key Features

Scan selected components or frames for design tokens

Supports primitives, spacing, and typography

Converts tokens into Android-compatible Kotlin objects (Colors.kt, Dimens.kt, Typography.kt)

Outputs clean, structured Kotlin code using dp, sp, and Color(...)

Friendly UI with JSON preview and file export options


Perfect for Android teams using Jetpack Compose and looking to keep design & code in sync.
138456.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Android-ready Kotlin files.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Token Architect
plugins.description:
Token Architect is a comprehensive design token management solution that bridges the gap between Figma and your development workflow. Create, export, and import design tokens with intelligent automation and bidirectional sync capabilities.


KEY FEATURES:

  1. Generate Complete Token Systems - Create comprehensive design tokens from a single brand colour with automatic shade generation
  2. Smart Color Palette Generation - Transform any colour into professional 100-900 shade scales with HSL-based algorithms
  3. Export Figma Variables - Convert your Figma variables into industry-standard JSON tokens
  4. Import External Tokens - Bring design tokens from popular tools (Style Dictionary, Design Tokens W3C) into Figma
  5. Advanced Token Classification - Automatic organisation into primitives and semantic token hierarchies
  6. Multi-Category Support - Colours, spacing, typography, responsive breakpoints, and semantic tokens
  7. Real-time Preview & Validation - Live JSON output with comprehensive debugging capabilities


PERFECT FOR:

  1. Design system managers building tokens from scratch or maintaining consistency
  2. Frontend developers implementing design tokens in modern frameworks
  3. Teams using tools like Style Dictionary, Tokens Studio, or custom token pipelines
  4. Organisations scaling design systems across products and platforms



Please reach out to ozarg.studio@gmail.com if you have any issues or would like to request a feature. Or let's connect on LinkedIn. Cool ideas welcome :)

accepted.name: OZAR STUDIO
accepted.description: We are a design studio working worldwide . We provide a range of design and development services.

plugins.tagline: Export and Import your variables in a developer-friendy way

plugins.name: Tokenize Your Design
plugins.description:
Tokenize Your Design helps you bring consistency and scalability to your Figma files by automatically replacing static colors with matching token values from your design system.


Key features:

Scan your entire design file to detect non-token colors

Match them with the color tokens from your local design system

Maintain consistent styling across large-scale designs


Perfect for design system maintainers, developers and teams aiming to scale design efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Bring consistency to your design by mapping colors to design system tokens.

133450.name: Tokenize Your Design
133450.description:
Tokenize Your Design helps you bring consistency and scalability to your Figma files by automatically replacing static colors with matching token values from your design system.


Key features:

Scan your entire design file to detect non-token colors

Match them with the color tokens from your local design system

Maintain consistent styling across large-scale designs


Perfect for design system maintainers, developers and teams aiming to scale design efficiently.

133450.tagline: Bring consistency to your design by mapping colors to design system tokens.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

132111.name: Blueprint
132111.description:

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows

plugins.name: Section Logger
plugins.description: No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificacin en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseo con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organizacin, colaboracin y eficiencia. Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
plugins.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseo veloz.

129666.name: Section Logger
129666.description: No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificacin en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseo con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organizacin, colaboracin y eficiencia. Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
129666.release_notes:
Release Note: Versin 1.1

Nuevas funcionalidades:
1.Soporte de idioma (Espaol/Ingls):
Se ha implementado un selector de idioma en la UI del plugin, que permite cambiar entre espaol e ingls con un switch/slider intuitivo.
El idioma de la interfaz (ttulos, botones y textos) cambia dinmicamente segn la seleccin del usuario.
El texto de los logs registrados tambin cambia de idioma, mostrando la informacin correctamente tanto en espaol como en ingls, dependiendo del idioma seleccionado.
2.Actualizacin de sticker:
Mejora de la gestin de stickers: Ahora, si un sticker ya existe, se actualiza con los nuevos logs en lugar de crear uno nuevo cada vez que se registra una edicin.
Si el sticker ya est presente, su contenido se limpia y se reemplaza con los nuevos logs, garantizando que no haya stickers duplicados.

Mejoras adicionales:
Se mejor el posicionamiento dinmico del sticker, asegurando que se mantenga correctamente ubicado en la esquina superior izquierda de la seccin.
Se optimiz el cdigo para hacer el plugin ms eficiente y evitar la creacin de stickers innecesarios.

Fixes:
Se solucion un problema en el que un nuevo sticker se creaba cada vez que se registraba un log, incluso si ya exista uno previamente.
129666.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseo veloz.

plugins.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator
plugins.description:
A plugin that helps you easily explore and manage complex Figma pages by generating a Table of Contents (TOC).


Features

1. In-plugin TOC generation

  1. Automatically collects frames with a specified prefix to generate a TOC
  2. Currently sorts frames based on their X-axis position on the Figma canvas (support for layer order coming soon)
  3. Click items to instantly navigate to the corresponding frame
  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  1. Create a TOC frame directly on the Figma canvas
  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click Update to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
plugins.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix.Click items to quickly navigate.

128139.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator
128139.description:
A plugin that helps you easily explore and manage complex Figma pages by generating a Table of Contents (TOC).


Features

1. In-plugin TOC generation

  1. Automatically collects frames with a specified prefix to generate a TOC
  2. Currently sorts frames based on their X-axis position on the Figma canvas (support for layer order coming soon)
  3. Click items to instantly navigate to the corresponding frame
  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  1. Create a TOC frame directly on the Figma canvas
  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click Update to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
128139.release_notes: Optimized speed of extracting frames for TOC
128139.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix.Click items to quickly navigate.

plugins.name: ColourSwatch
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.
plugins.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

127153.name: ColourSwatch
127153.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.

networkAccess.reasoning: No network access needed for the plugin.

127153.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer Smarter Layer Naming


A Figma plugin that keeps your layers organized by automatically generating clear, descriptive names based on their properties. Perfect for maintaining a consistent and readable file structure in complex designs.


Just select your layers and run the plugin names will be updated instantly based on your settings.


Layer properties included:

  1. Dimensions (width height)
  2. Fill color (HEX code)
  3. Opacity values
  4. Effects (shadows, blurs)
  5. Constraints
  6. Corner radius
  7. Stroke details
  8. Auto Layout settings

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Automatically rename layers based on design properties

plugins.name: Cool Names Generator
plugins.description: Do you want to generate names for your mockups? This plugin helps you generation random character names from various categories including video game characters, superheroes, and famous movie characters.
plugins.tagline: Instantly replace generic text by movie character names to your Figma designs.

plugins.name: QD - Revix - AI Feedback
plugins.description:
Get AI-Powered UI/UX Feedback Instantly!


Struggling to spot design issues? Let AI do the work! This powerful plugin analyzes your designs, provides insightful UI/UX feedback, and instantly adds comments, helping you refine your work faster and smarter.


How it works:

Select a design frame and start the analysis.

Get multiple AI-generated feedback suggestions.

Instantly add feedback as comments on your design.


Save time, improve usability, and design with confidence. all with the power of AI!
plugins.tagline: AI feedback and comments on designs

plugins.name: Gename Thai
plugins.description:
Generate Random Thai Names Plugin


Quickly generate random Thai names for your designs! This plugin allows you to select one or multiple text fields and generate random names for males or females, with the option to include or exclude surnames.


Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!


---


!

: "Generate"
plugins.tagline: Generate Thai name

plugins.name: Unit
plugins.description: Unit is a lightweight tool that helps designers and developers extract CSS friendly measurements directly from Figma. No more manual conversions, just copy and paste values into your code.
plugins.tagline: Copy CSS Ready Code From Figma Instantly.

plugins.name: Customizable Variable Export
plugins.description:
A UI that lets you export your variables to JSON and TypeScript.


Customize your JSON exports with:

  1. flat or nested structures
  2. hex-codes or RGBA values for colors


Find the project on GitHub: helpwave/figma-export-plugin
plugins.tagline: Export your variables to JSON and TypeScirpt!

plugins.name: Text Tuner
plugins.description: Text Tuner scans your active Figma page to find all text layers and groups them by font family, font weight, and size. In the list, you can click a group to jump to all matching text layers and change their text size, font family, or font weight on the current page.

accepted.name: Akshay Benny
accepted.description: Full Stack Web Developer who loves to explore new tech.

plugins.tagline: Text Tuner finds and edits text styles in Figma fastupdate fonts, weights, and sizes effortlessly!

120742.name: Text Tuner

120742.tagline: Text Tuner finds and edits text styles in Figma fastupdate fonts, weights, and sizes effortlessly!

plugins.name: DevPlugin - Copy Disign
plugins.description:
DevPlugin is a plugin for fast migration of components.


DevPlugin automates the process of obtaining and implementing components into web projects. The plugin creates secure scripts based on the layout and allows you to use them on any external resources.


What he can do:

  1. Generating a custom JS script
  2. Personal account with subscription management and action history
  3. Data encryption and protection of user tokens


Fits:

  1. UI/UX designer
  2. Developers of landing pages and interfaces
  3. To the authors of design systems
plugins.tagline: We will help you transfer your design to the constructor with all the adaptive designs.
